All official information can be found on the agencies' own websites. Our guides are for guidance only and do not replace official information.

oslo.name: Oslo
oslo.description: Norway's capital with NAV offices in all districts
oslo.intro: Oslo is Norway's capital with over 700,000 inhabitants. Here you'll find an overview of all public services in Oslo, including NAV offices in all districts, the Tax Administration and health services. Use this page to find addresses, opening hours and contact information.
oslo.faq1q: Where can I find a NAV office in Oslo?
oslo.faq1a: Oslo has NAV offices in all districts. You can find your local office based on where you live: NAV Gamle Oslo, NAV Grünerløkka, NAV Sagene, NAV St. Hanshaugen, NAV Frogner, NAV Ullern, NAV Vestre Aker, NAV Nordre Aker, NAV Bjerke, NAV Grorud, NAV Stovner, NAV Alna, NAV Østensjø, NAV Nordstrand and NAV Søndre Nordstrand.
oslo.faq2q: What are the opening hours for NAV in Oslo?
oslo.faq2a: NAV offices in Oslo are generally open weekdays 09:00-15:00. Drop-in is usually 10:00-14:30. Call 55 55 33 33 to check opening hours for your office, as some offices may have different times.
oslo.faq3q: Where is the Tax Administration in Oslo?
oslo.faq3a: The Tax Administration has offices in central Oslo. You can also use the digital services at skatteetaten.no for most tasks such as tax returns, tax cards and moving notices.
oslo.faq4q: Where can I find the emergency room in Oslo?
oslo.faq4a: Oslo Emergency Room is located at Storgata 40 (City Center). Open 24 hours. Phone: 116 117. For life-threatening situations, call 113. There are also emergency rooms in several districts.
oslo.faq5q: How do I book an appointment with my GP in Oslo?
oslo.faq5a: You book an appointment with your GP via Helsenorge.no. Log in with BankID, select 'Appointments', and find your GP. You can also call the doctor's office directly. Don't have a GP? Apply for one at Helsenorge.no.

bergen.name: Bergen
bergen.description: Western Norway's capital with four NAV offices
bergen.intro: Bergen is Norway's second largest city with about 290,000 inhabitants. Here you'll find an overview of NAV offices, the Tax Administration and health services in Bergen. Bergen has four NAV offices that serve different parts of the city.
bergen.faq1q: Where are the NAV offices in Bergen?
bergen.faq1a: Bergen has four NAV offices: NAV Bergenhus, NAV Årstad, NAV Fana and NAV Åsane. Your local office depends on which part of the city you live in.
bergen.faq2q: Where can I find the emergency room in Bergen?
bergen.faq2a: Bergen Emergency Room is located at Solheimsgaten 9. Open 24 hours. Phone: 116 117. For life-threatening situations, call 113.
bergen.faq3q: How do I get to the Tax Administration in Bergen?
bergen.faq3a: Most services are available digitally at skatteetaten.no. For physical visits, check skatteetaten.no for current opening hours and address in Bergen.

trondheim.name: Trondheim
trondheim.description: The technology capital in Central Norway
trondheim.intro: Trondheim is Norway's third largest city with about 210,000 inhabitants and is known as the technology capital. Here you'll find information about NAV offices, the Tax Administration and health services in Trondheim.
trondheim.faq1q: Where are the NAV offices in Trondheim?
trondheim.faq1a: Trondheim has several NAV offices: NAV Midtbyen, NAV Østbyen, NAV Lerkendal and NAV Heimdal. Your local office depends on where you live in the city.
trondheim.faq2q: Where is the emergency room in Trondheim?
trondheim.faq2a: Trondheim Emergency Room is located at Mauritz Hansens gate 4. Open 24 hours. Phone: 116 117. For life-threatening situations, call 113.
trondheim.faq3q: What public transport is available in Trondheim?
trondheim.faq3a: Trondheim has buses and trams (Gråkallbanen) operated by AtB. You can plan your journey at atb.no or in the AtB app.

stavanger.name: Stavanger
stavanger.description: The oil capital with five NAV offices
stavanger.intro: Stavanger is Norway's fourth largest city with about 145,000 inhabitants and is known as the oil capital. Here you'll find information about NAV offices, the Tax Administration and health services in Stavanger and the surrounding area.
stavanger.faq1q: Where are the NAV offices in Stavanger?
stavanger.faq1a: Stavanger has NAV offices in Stavanger, Sandnes, Sola, Randaberg and the surrounding municipalities. Your local office depends on where you are registered.
stavanger.faq2q: Where can I find the emergency room in Stavanger?
stavanger.faq2a: Stavanger Emergency Room is located at Armauer Hansens vei 30. Open 24 hours. Phone: 116 117. For life-threatening situations, call 113.
stavanger.faq3q: What public transport is available in Stavanger?
stavanger.faq3a: Stavanger has buses and Bybanen operated by Kolumbus. You can plan your journey at kolumbus.no or in the Kolumbus app.

kristiansand.name: Kristiansand
kristiansand.description: Southern Norway's capital with a central NAV office
kristiansand.intro: Kristiansand is Southern Norway's largest city with about 115,000 inhabitants. Here you'll find information about NAV offices, the Tax Administration and health services in Kristiansand.
kristiansand.faq1q: Where is the NAV office in Kristiansand?
kristiansand.faq1a: Kristiansand has a central NAV office in the city center that serves all inhabitants. There are also offices in the surrounding municipalities.
kristiansand.faq2q: Where can I find the emergency room in Kristiansand?
kristiansand.faq2a: Kristiansand Emergency Room is located at Eg. Open 24 hours. Phone: 116 117. For life-threatening situations, call 113.
kristiansand.faq3q: What public transport is available in Kristiansand?
kristiansand.faq3a: Kristiansand has buses operated by AKT. You can plan your journey at akt.no or in the AKT app.

loggInn.title: Log in to NAV
loggInn.description: Learn how to log in to nav.no with BankID or MinID
loggInn.longDescription: Learn how to log in to nav.no so you can view your cases, apply for benefits and send messages.
loggInn.beforeYouStartText: You need BankID (on mobile or code device) or MinID to log in. If you don't have this, you need to get one of these first.
loggInn.stepsTitle: How to log in to NAV
loggInn.problemsText: If you have problems logging in, you can try the following:
problemsList: Check that you entered the correct national ID number
Try refreshing the page (press F5 or Ctrl+R)

steps.title: Go to nav.no
steps.description: Open your browser (for example Google Chrome, Safari or Edge). Type "nav.no" in the address bar at the top and press Enter.
steps.tip: You can also search for "NAV" on Google and click the first result.

steps.title: Find the "Log in" button
steps.description: On the front page of nav.no you will see a blue button in the top right that says "Logg inn". Click this button.
steps.tip: The button may also be called "Min side" or "Ditt NAV".

steps.title: Choose login method
steps.description: You now get the choice between several ways to log in. The most common are BankID on mobile, BankID with code device, or MinID. Choose the one you have access to.
steps.warning: If you don't have BankID or MinID, you need to contact your bank or visit a NAV office for help.

steps.title: If you choose BankID on mobile
steps.description: Enter your national ID number (11 digits) and your phone number. You will receive a message on your phone. Open the BankID app and confirm the login with fingerprint or code.
steps.tip: Make sure the BankID app is installed on your phone before you start.

steps.title: If you choose BankID with code device
steps.description: Enter your national ID number. Turn on the code device and enter the code shown on the screen. Then enter your personal code on the code device and type in the new code that appears.
steps.warning: The code device needs battery. If the screen is empty, it needs a new battery or you need to contact your bank.

steps.title: You are now logged in!
steps.description: Congratulations! You are now logged in to NAV. You can see your inbox, your applications, and send messages to NAV. The menu on the left side shows all the services you have access to.
steps.tip: Remember to log out when you are done, especially if you are using a shared computer.

dagpenger.title: Apply for unemployment benefits
dagpenger.description: Step-by-step guide to apply for unemployment benefits if you've lost your job
dagpenger.longDescription: Unemployment benefits (dagpenger) are money you can receive from NAV if you have lost your job or been laid off. Here we show you step-by-step how to apply.
dagpenger.whoCanGetIntro: To receive unemployment benefits you usually must:
requirements: Have earned at least NOK 186,042 in the last 12 months, or NOK 372,084 in the last 36 months (2024 rates)
Have had your working hours reduced by at least 50%
Be registered as a job seeker and actively looking for work
Live in Norway and have the right to work here
documents: Termination letter or layoff notice from your employer
Employment contract (if you have it available)
Bank account number where you want payment
dagpenger.stepsTitle: How to apply for unemployment benefits
dagpenger.importantMeldekortText: You must submit an employment status form every 14 days to continue receiving unemployment benefits. Do this at nav.no.
dagpenger.importantJobsearchText: You must actively search for jobs and document this. NAV may ask you to show your job applications.
dagpenger.importantAmountText: Unemployment benefits are about 62.4% of previous income, up to 6G (approx. NOK 744,000). Money is usually paid in arrears.

steps.title: Register as a job seeker first
steps.description: Before you can apply for unemployment benefits, you must register as a job seeker with NAV. Go to nav.no, log in, and select "Register as a job seeker". Fill in information about your education and work experience.
steps.tip: You can register as a job seeker the same day you apply for unemployment benefits.
steps.warning: You must register as a job seeker BEFORE applying for unemployment benefits, otherwise your application will be rejected.

steps.title: Log in to nav.no
steps.description: Go to nav.no and log in with BankID or MinID. Click "Log in" in the top right corner of the page.
steps.tip: See our guide "Log in to NAV" if you need help logging in.

steps.title: Find the unemployment benefits application
steps.description: After logging in, go to "Ditt NAV" or "My services". Then click on "Applications" or search for "dagpenger" in the search field. Select "Application for unemployment benefits".
steps.tip: You can also type "dagpenger" in the search field on nav.no to find the application directly.

steps.title: Fill in personal information
steps.description: The application starts by showing your personal information (name, address, etc.). Check that this is correct. If something is wrong, you must change it in the Population Register before continuing.
steps.warning: Check that your bank account number is correct! This is where the money will be paid.

steps.title: State the reason for your application
steps.description: Select why you are applying for unemployment benefits: have you lost your job, been laid off, or had reduced working hours? Answer all questions honestly.
steps.tip: If you are unsure what to answer, you can select "Don't know" and explain your situation in the comments field.

steps.title: Upload documentation
steps.description: You must upload documents that confirm your situation. This can be a termination letter, layoff notice, or employment contract. Click "Upload file" and select the document from your computer.
steps.warning: Accepted file formats are PDF, JPG and PNG. Maximum file size is usually 10 MB.
steps.tip: Take a photo of paper documents with your phone and upload the image if you don't have a scanner.

steps.title: Enter previous income
steps.description: NAV automatically retrieves information about your previous income from the Tax Office. Check that this looks correct. If you have had income that is not showing, you must add it manually.
steps.tip: Unemployment benefits are calculated from your income over the last 12 or 36 months, depending on which gives the highest amount.

steps.title: Answer additional questions
steps.description: The application may contain more questions about your situation, such as whether you have other income, are in school, or have health problems that affect job searching. Answer everything honestly.

steps.title: Review and submit
steps.description: Before submitting, you get a summary of the application. Read through everything carefully. If something is wrong, go back and correct it. When everything is correct, click "Submit application".
steps.warning: After submission, you cannot change the application. You would need to contact NAV.

steps.title: Confirmation and next steps
steps.description: You will receive confirmation on screen and by email/SMS that the application has been received. NAV usually processes applications within 4 weeks. Remember to submit the employment status form every 14 days!
steps.tip: You can track the status of your application under "My cases" at nav.no.

sykepenger.title: Apply for sick pay
sykepenger.description: How to submit sick leave and apply for sick pay
sykepenger.longDescription: Sick pay replaces your income when you are ill and cannot work. Here we show you step-by-step how to apply.
requirements: You have been employed for at least 4 weeks before you became ill
You earn at least NOK 59,310 per year (half of the base amount)
You have a sick note from a doctor
You have lost income due to illness
sykepenger.importantToKnow: Important to know about sick pay
sykepenger.employerPeriodText: The first 16 days, your employer pays sick pay. You don't need to apply to NAV.
sykepenger.navPeriodText: From day 17, NAV takes over. Then you must submit an application.
sykepenger.howMuchText: You get 100% of your income, up to 6G (approx. NOK 744,000). Your employer may cover more.
sykepenger.howLongText: You can receive sick pay for up to 52 weeks (1 year). After that, you may be entitled to AAP.
sykepenger.stepsTitle: How to apply for sick pay
sykepenger.gradedIntro: Graded sick leave means you work some, but not full time. For example:
sykepenger.graded50: 50% sick leave: You work half a day and receive sick pay for the rest
sykepenger.graded80: 80% sick leave: You work one day a week and receive sick pay for 4 days
sykepenger.gradedBenefit: Graded sick leave is often good because you maintain contact with your job and return faster.

steps.title: Get a sick note from the doctor
steps.description: First, you need to get a sick note from your doctor. The doctor sends the sick note electronically to NAV and your employer. You don't need to do anything with the sick note itself.
steps.tip: You can be issued a sick note by your GP, emergency room, or specialist. Dentists and chiropractors can also issue sick notes in some cases.

steps.title: Log in to nav.no
steps.description: Go to nav.no and log in with BankID or MinID. Click "Log in" in the top right corner.
steps.tip: Your sick note usually appears on nav.no within 1-2 days after the doctor's visit.

steps.title: Find your sick note
steps.description: After logging in, go to "Ditt sykefravær" (Your sick leave) or look for a notification about a new sick note on the front page. Click on the sick note to open it.

steps.title: Submit the sick note to your employer
steps.description: You must confirm the sick note and send it to your employer. Select the correct employer from the list (if you have multiple jobs) and click "Send".
steps.warning: You must submit the sick note within 3 months, otherwise you may lose the right to sick pay.

steps.title: Fill out application for sick pay (after 16 days)
steps.description: The first 16 days, your employer pays sick pay. After that, you must apply to NAV. You will be notified on nav.no when it's time to apply. Fill out the application with information about work and income.
steps.tip: NAV retrieves a lot of information automatically. You just need to confirm that it's correct.

steps.title: Answer questions about activity
steps.description: In the application, you will be asked if you have worked during the sick period, if you have traveled, and if you have received other income. Answer all questions honestly.
steps.warning: If you have worked, you must report the hours. This affects how much sick pay you receive.

steps.title: Submit the application
steps.description: When you have filled out everything, click "Submit application". You will receive confirmation that the application has been received.

steps.title: Wait for response
steps.description: NAV processes your application, usually within 4 weeks. You can see the status of your application under "My cases" on nav.no. The money is paid in arrears.
steps.tip: Sick pay is usually paid on the 25th of the month for the previous month.

foreldrepenger.title: Apply for parental benefits
foreldrepenger.description: Everything you need to know about parental benefits and how to apply
foreldrepenger.longDescription: Parental benefits give you income when you are home with your child. Here we explain everything you need to know to apply.
foreldrepenger.remainingWeeks: The remaining weeks can be shared freely between the parents.
foreldrepenger.youHaveRight: You have the right to parental benefits if:
rightConditions: You have had income for at least 6 of the last 10 months
You earn at least NOK 59,310 per year (0.5G)
The income comes from employment, freelance work, or self-employment
foreldrepenger.noRightTitle: Don't have the right to parental benefits?
foreldrepenger.noRightText: Then you may be entitled to a lump sum grant (approx. NOK 92,000) instead. Apply for this the same way on nav.no.
foreldrepenger.stepsTitle: How to apply for parental benefits
foreldrepenger.date4WeeksBefore: Earliest you can apply for parental benefits
foreldrepenger.calculatorText: On nav.no you can use a calculator that shows exactly what you can get in parental benefits. Search for "foreldrepengekalkulator" on nav.no.

steps.title: Check that you are entitled to parental benefits
steps.description: You must have worked and had income for at least 6 of the last 10 months before the leave starts. You must also earn at least NOK 59,310 per year.
steps.tip: Unsure? Use the calculator on nav.no to see what you can get.

steps.title: Log in to nav.no
steps.description: Go to nav.no and log in with BankID. Click "Log in" in the top right corner.

steps.title: Find the parental benefits application
steps.description: Search for "foreldrepenger" in the search field, or go to "Family and children" and select "Application for parental benefits". You can apply at the earliest 4 weeks before the due date.
steps.warning: Apply at the latest the day before the leave starts so you don't lose money!

steps.title: Fill in information about yourself
steps.description: Confirm your personal information: name, address, and bank account number. Check that the account number is correct - that's where the money will go.

steps.title: Provide information about the child
steps.description: Enter the due date or birth date. If the child is born, also provide the child's name and national ID number. For adoption, provide the date of care transfer.

steps.title: Choose coverage level
steps.description: You can choose between 100% coverage for 49 weeks or 80% coverage for 59 weeks. The total amount is the same, but the distribution is different.
steps.tip: 100% gives higher monthly payments but shorter leave. 80% gives lower monthly payments but longer leave.

steps.title: Plan the leave
steps.description: Distribute the weeks between mother and father/co-mother. Remember that some weeks are reserved for mother (3 weeks before birth) and some are reserved for father (paternity quota of 15 weeks).
steps.warning: The paternity quota must be used, otherwise it is lost! It cannot be transferred to the mother.

steps.title: Upload documentation
steps.description: You may be asked to upload confirmation of due date from doctor/midwife, or documentation of work income if NAV doesn't have this.
steps.tip: You get the due date confirmation at the first prenatal check-up, usually around week 8.

steps.title: Submit the application
steps.description: Review all the information. When everything is correct, click "Submit application". You will receive confirmation by email.
steps.tip: Processing time is usually 4-6 weeks. Apply well in advance!

arbeidsledig.title: Register as unemployed
arbeidsledig.description: Register as a job seeker at NAV
arbeidsledig.longDescription: When you lose your job, you must register as a job seeker at NAV. This is the first step to receive unemployment benefits and help finding a new job.

whyReasons.title: Get unemployment benefits
whyReasons.text: You must be registered to apply for unemployment benefits

whyReasons.title: Find jobs
whyReasons.text: Employers can find you on arbeidsplassen.nav.no

whyReasons.title: Get courses and programs
whyReasons.text: NAV can offer you courses, internships or other help

whyReasons.title: Get follow-up
whyReasons.text: You get an advisor who helps you with job searching

arbeidsledig.warningText: Unemployment benefits are calculated from the day you register. If you wait, you may lose money. Register preferably on your first day without a job.
arbeidsledig.prepareTitle: Have this ready before you start
prepareItems: Overview of previous jobs (employer, period, position)
CV (nice to have, but not required)
arbeidsledig.stepsTitle: How to register as a job seeker

afterSteps.title: You become visible to employers
afterSteps.text: Your CV can be seen by companies looking for employees

afterSteps.title: NAV assesses your situation
afterSteps.text: You will be informed about what follow-up you need

afterSteps.title: You can apply for unemployment benefits
afterSteps.text: If you are entitled to benefits, you can apply immediately

afterSteps.title: Keep your profile updated
afterSteps.text: Update your CV regularly and actively apply for jobs

steps.title: Go to nav.no
steps.description: Open your browser and go to nav.no. Click "Log in" in the top right corner and log in with BankID or MinID.

steps.title: Find "Register as job seeker"
steps.description: After logging in, look for "Work" in the menu or search for "register job seeker". Click on "Register as job seeker".
steps.tip: You can also go directly to arbeidsplassen.nav.no.

steps.title: Confirm personal information
steps.description: Check that your name, address and contact information are correct. If something is wrong, you must change it in the National Registry or contact NAV.

steps.title: Enter your education
steps.description: Fill in your highest completed education. Select level (primary school, high school, trade certificate, college, etc.) and describe what kind of education you have.
steps.tip: The more detailed you are, the better NAV can help you find suitable jobs.

steps.title: Add work experience
steps.description: List the jobs you have had. For each job, provide employer, position, and how long you worked there. Start with the most recent job.
steps.tip: Include all jobs, including part-time and summer jobs. Everything counts!

steps.title: Enter skills and competencies
steps.description: Add skills you have: languages, computer skills, certificates, driver's license, etc. This helps employers find you.

steps.title: Choose what kind of job you're looking for
steps.description: Select job categories and industries you are interested in. You can choose several. Also specify where you are willing to work geographically.
steps.tip: Be open to different opportunities - it increases your chances of finding a job quickly.

steps.title: Confirm that you are a genuine job seeker
steps.description: You must confirm that you are willing to work, participate in programs and meetings, and actively seek employment. Check the boxes to confirm you meet the requirements.
steps.warning: If you do not meet the activity requirements, you may lose your right to unemployment benefits.

steps.title: Complete the registration
steps.description: Review all the information. Click "Complete registration" when everything is correct. You are now registered as a job seeker!

steps.title: Apply for unemployment benefits (if applicable)
steps.description: After registration, you will be asked if you want to apply for unemployment benefits. If you are entitled to benefits, click "Apply now" to start the application.
steps.tip: See our guide "Apply for unemployment benefits" for detailed help with the application.

meldekort.title: Submit employment status form
meldekort.description: How to fill out and submit your employment status form every 14 days
meldekort.longDescription: The employment status form (meldekort) is a report you send to NAV every 14 days to receive unemployment benefits. It only takes a few minutes!
meldekort.deadlineText: You must submit the form on time to receive payment. If you submit late, you may lose money. The deadline is Monday at 11:00 PM after the 14-day period ends.

calendarSteps.label: Week 1-2
calendarSteps.text: You work/search for jobs and track your activity

calendarSteps.label: Monday
calendarSteps.text: The form becomes available (after the period ends)

calendarSteps.label: Payment
calendarSteps.text: Usually 2-3 business days after you submit

meldekort.stepsTitle: How to fill out the form
meldekort.faqTitle: Common questions about the employment form

faq.question: What happens if I forget to submit the form?
faq.answer: You won't receive payment for that period. Submit the form as soon as you remember - you can still submit up to 8 days late, but you will get a deduction in your payment.

faq.question: Do I need to submit the form when I'm sick?
faq.answer: Yes, you still need to submit the form. Mark that you were sick on the relevant days.

faq.question: Can I change a form I've already submitted?
faq.answer: No, but you can contact NAV if you made a mistake. Call 55 55 33 33.

faq.question: I got a job - do I still need to submit the form?
faq.answer: Yes, submit the form for the period until you started your job. Enter the hours you worked.

steps.title: Log in to nav.no
steps.description: Go to nav.no and log in with BankID or MinID. You can also use the NAV app on your phone.
steps.tip: Download the NAV app to get reminders about the form!

steps.title: Find the form
steps.description: After logging in, look for "Meldekort" on the front page or in the menu. Click on "Send meldekort" or "New meldekort".
steps.warning: The form becomes available on the day you can submit it, not before.

steps.title: Check that the period is correct
steps.description: The form covers the last 14 days. Check that the dates at the top of the form match the period you are reporting for.

steps.title: Answer questions about work
steps.description: You will be asked if you worked during the period. Answer "Yes" or "No" for each week. If you worked, you must enter how many hours.
steps.tip: Be accurate with the hours. This affects how much you get paid.
steps.warning: Entering incorrect hours can result in having to pay back money.

steps.title: Answer questions about illness
steps.description: If you were sick and couldn't work or search for jobs, mark this. If you were sick for more than 3 days, you may be entitled to sickness benefits.

steps.title: Answer questions about vacation/absence
steps.description: Did you take vacation, travel abroad, or have other absences? Enter this for the relevant days. You do not receive unemployment benefits for vacation days.

steps.title: Answer questions about courses/education
steps.description: If you attended courses or took education, enter this. Some courses qualify for unemployment benefits, others do not.

steps.title: Confirm that you are a job seeker
steps.description: You must confirm that you are still looking for work and willing to take a job. Check the boxes to confirm you meet the requirements.

steps.title: Review and submit
steps.description: Review all your answers. If everything is correct, click "Send meldekort". You will receive confirmation that the form has been submitted.
steps.tip: Take a screenshot of the confirmation for your own documentation.

pensjon.title: Apply for retirement pension
pensjon.description: Step-by-step guide to apply for retirement pension from NAV
pensjon.longDescription: Retirement pension is money you receive from NAV when you get older. Here we show you how to check what you're entitled to and how to apply.
pensjon.whoCanGetIntro: You can start receiving retirement pension when you:
requirements: Are between 62 and 75 years old (you choose when to start)
Have lived or worked in Norway for at least 5 years after turning 16
Are a member of the National Insurance Scheme

importantChoices.title: When should you start?
importantChoices.description: The earlier you take out pension, the less you get per month. If you wait until 67, you get full pension. Take it at 62, and you get less - but over more years.

importantChoices.title: How much do you want to withdraw?
importantChoices.description: You can withdraw 20%, 40%, 50%, 60%, 80% or 100% of your pension. You can work alongside without your pension being reduced.

importantChoices.title: Do you want to combine with work?
importantChoices.description: You can work as much as you want alongside retirement pension. Your income does not affect the pension.

documents: Account number where you want the pension paid
Overview of any stays abroad (if you have lived in other countries)
pensjon.stepsTitle: How to apply for retirement pension

steps.title: Check your pension on nav.no first
steps.description: Before applying, you should check what you can get. Go to nav.no and log in. Search for "Din pensjon" or go to "Pensjon" in the menu. Here you see how much you can get at different ages.
steps.tip: The pension calculator shows you exactly how much you'll get at 62, 67 or other ages. Take time to understand this first!

steps.title: Decide when and how much
steps.description: Based on the calculator, decide when you want to start and how much you want to withdraw. Remember: you can change the withdrawal rate later, but you cannot undo starting withdrawal.
steps.warning: Once you have started withdrawing pension, you cannot stop completely. You can only change how much you withdraw.

steps.title: Log in to nav.no
steps.description: Go to nav.no and log in with BankID or MinID. Click "Log in" in the top right corner.
steps.tip: See our guide "Log in to NAV" if you need help.

steps.title: Find the pension application
steps.description: After logging in, go to "Pensjon" in the menu or search for "søk alderspensjon". Click on "Søk om alderspensjon".
steps.tip: You can also call NAV at 55 55 33 33 and get help applying over the phone.

steps.title: Fill in personal information
steps.description: The application shows your personal information. Check that name, address and account number are correct. If something is wrong, you must change it before continuing.
steps.warning: Check the account number carefully - that's where the pension will be paid!

steps.title: Choose when to start withdrawal
steps.description: Select which month you want to start receiving pension. You can start at the earliest the month after you apply.
steps.tip: Most people choose to start from the 1st of a month for simplicity.

steps.title: Choose withdrawal rate
steps.description: Choose how much of your pension you want to withdraw: 20%, 40%, 50%, 60%, 80% or 100%. You see how much this amounts to in kroner per month.
steps.tip: Many choose 100% when they stop working completely, or a lower rate if they continue part-time.

steps.title: Provide any AFP information
steps.description: If you have AFP (contractual early retirement pension) from your employer, you must provide this. AFP and retirement pension can be combined.
steps.tip: Unsure if you have AFP? Ask your employer or check with your pension fund.

steps.title: Provide information about stays abroad
steps.description: If you have lived or worked in other countries, you must provide this. It may affect how much pension you get from Norway and whether you're entitled to pension from other countries.
steps.tip: EU/EEA countries and countries Norway has social security agreements with may also entitle you to pension from there.

steps.title: Review and submit
steps.description: Check all the information. When everything is correct, click "Send søknad". You will receive confirmation on screen and by email.
steps.tip: Keep the confirmation. NAV usually processes the application within 4 weeks.

pensjon.importantTitle: Important to know about retirement pension

importantInfo.title: Tax deduction
importantInfo.description: Tax is deducted from your pension. You can change the tax deduction at skatteetaten.no.

importantInfo.title: Payment
importantInfo.description: Pension is usually paid around the 20th of each month.

importantInfo.title: Can be changed
importantInfo.description: You can change the withdrawal rate (how much you withdraw) once per year.

importantInfo.title: Working alongside
importantInfo.description: You can work as much as you want without your pension being reduced. You also continue to earn more pension if you work.

faq.question: When should I withdraw pension?
faq.answer: It depends on your situation. If you withdraw early (62-66), you get less per month, but over more years. If you wait until 67 or later, you get more per month. Use the calculator on nav.no to see what suits you.

faq.question: Can I work and have pension at the same time?
faq.answer: Yes! You can work as much as you want without your pension being reduced. You even continue to earn more pension when you work.

faq.question: What is the difference between retirement pension and AFP?
faq.answer: Retirement pension is from the National Insurance Scheme (NAV) and everyone is entitled to it. AFP is a supplementary pension from employers who have an AFP agreement. You can have both at the same time.

faq.question: Can I regret if I withdraw pension too early?
faq.answer: No, you cannot stop the withdrawal completely once you have started. But you can reduce the withdrawal rate down to 20%.

uforetrygd.title: Apply for disability benefit
uforetrygd.description: Step-by-step guide to apply for disability benefit when health prevents you from working
uforetrygd.longDescription: Disability benefit is money you can receive from NAV if you cannot work due to illness or injury. Here we show you how to apply.
uforetrygd.whoCanGetIntro: To receive disability benefit you usually must:
requirements: Be between 18 and 67 years old
Have been a member of the National Insurance Scheme for the last 5 years before you became ill
Have permanently reduced work capacity due to illness or injury
Have tried treatment and work-related measures without sufficient improvement
uforetrygd.beforeApplyingText: NAV usually requires that you have tried other things first:
beforeApplying: Been on sick leave and received sick pay
Been on work assessment allowance (AAP) and tried measures
Received medical treatment for your illness/injury
documents: Medical certificate or medical documentation (NAV often retrieves this themselves)
Overview of previous treatment and measures you have tried
uforetrygd.stepsTitle: How to apply for disability benefit

steps.title: Talk to NAV first
steps.description: Before applying, you should have a conversation with your NAV advisor. They can assess whether you have tried enough measures and if the timing is right to apply.
steps.tip: Call NAV at 55 55 33 33 or request a conversation via nav.no.

steps.title: Ask your doctor for documentation
steps.description: Your GP must write a medical certificate describing your illness and how it affects your work capacity. NAV can also retrieve information directly from the doctor.
steps.tip: Tell your doctor that you plan to apply for disability benefit, so they can prepare the documentation.

steps.title: Log in to nav.no
steps.description: Go to nav.no and log in with BankID or MinID.
steps.tip: You can also apply on paper or get help at the NAV office.

steps.title: Find the disability benefit application
steps.description: Search for "uføretrygd" in the search field or go to "Applications" and find "Application for disability benefit".
steps.tip: The application is long - set aside enough time. You can save along the way and continue later.

steps.title: Fill in personal information
steps.description: Check that your personal information is correct. Provide account number for payment.
steps.warning: Check that the account number is correct - that's where the disability benefit will be paid.

steps.title: Describe your illness/injury
steps.description: You must explain what is wrong with you and how it affects your daily life and work capacity. Be honest and detailed.
steps.tip: Describe what a normal day looks like for you - what can you do and what can't you do?

steps.title: Provide treatment and measures
steps.description: List all treatment you have received and measures you have tried. This includes sick leave, AAP, medical treatment, surgeries, rehabilitation, etc.
steps.tip: The more documentation, the better. NAV needs to see that you have tried to get better.

steps.title: Provide work history
steps.description: Fill in information about the jobs you have had and your education. NAV uses this to calculate how much you will receive.
steps.tip: NAV retrieves a lot of information automatically, but check that it's correct.

steps.title: Submit the application
steps.description: Review all your answers and submit the application. You will receive confirmation that it has been received.
steps.warning: Processing time is often long - 3-6 months is common. You will be notified when NAV needs more information.

afterApplying.title: Monitor nav.no
afterApplying.description: Log in regularly to see if NAV has sent you messages or needs more information.

afterApplying.title: Attend appointments
afterApplying.description: NAV may call you in for a conversation or examination. It's important that you show up.

afterApplying.title: Respond to inquiries
afterApplying.description: If NAV asks for more documentation, respond as quickly as you can. It shortens the processing time.

uforetrygd.howMuchText: Disability benefit is usually 66% of your income before you became ill, up to 6G (approx. NOK 744,000). Minimum is approx. 2.5G for single people. You can also work a little alongside without losing all your disability benefit.
important: You can have graded disability benefit (e.g. 50%) and work part-time alongside
Disability benefit entitles you to retirement pension from age 67
You keep your disability benefit if you become sicker, but it can be reduced if you get better
You must notify NAV if your situation changes

skattemelding.title: Check tax return
skattemelding.description: How to find and check your tax return
skattemelding.longDescription: The tax return shows what you have earned and what you have paid in taxes. Here you learn how to check that everything is correct.
skattemelding.whatIsText1: The tax return (previously called "selvangivelsen") is an overview of all your income and deductions for the previous year. The Tax Office fills in most of it automatically based on information from employers, banks and others.
skattemelding.whatIsText2: Your job is to check that everything is correct and add any missing deductions.
skattemelding.stepsTitle: How to check your tax return

commonErrors.title: Missing income
commonErrors.text: Did you have a side job or sell something that isn't included?

commonErrors.title: Wrong work commute
commonErrors.text: Is the distance to work calculated correctly?

commonErrors.title: Missing loans
commonErrors.text: Are all your loans included so you get the interest deduction?

commonErrors.title: Wrong property value
commonErrors.text: Does the property value match the market price?

skattemelding.deadlineText: The deadline to check and submit the tax return is April 30th. If you don't make changes, it will be automatically approved with the pre-filled information.

steps.title: Go to skatteetaten.no
steps.description: Open your browser and type "skatteetaten.no" in the address bar. Press Enter to go to the page.
steps.tip: You can also search for "Skatteetaten" on Google.

steps.title: Log in with BankID
steps.description: Click "Log in" in the top right corner. Select BankID (mobile or code device) and follow the instructions to log in.
steps.warning: You need BankID to view your tax return. MinID does not work here.

steps.title: Find the tax return
steps.description: After logging in, you will arrive at "My page". Click on "Tax return" in the menu, or look for a box that says "Your tax return for [year]".
steps.tip: The tax return usually becomes available in March.

steps.title: Review your income
steps.description: The tax return shows all income the Tax Office has registered for you: salary, pension, interest, dividends, etc. Check that the numbers match what you have earned.
steps.warning: If something is missing or wrong, you must add or change it. You are responsible for ensuring the tax return is correct.

steps.title: Check the deductions
steps.description: Review the deductions listed. This can be interest expenses on loans, union fees, commuting expenses, etc. Some deductions are added automatically, others you must enter yourself.
steps.tip: Many people forget deductions! Check our guide about deductions to see what you can deduct.

steps.title: View calculated tax
steps.description: At the bottom of the tax return, you will see a calculation of your tax. Here you can see if you have paid too much or too little tax during the year.
steps.tip: Green number = you get money back. Red number = you have to pay additional tax.

steps.title: Make changes if necessary
steps.description: If something is wrong or missing, click "Edit" next to the relevant item. Fill in the correct information and save. You can make as many changes as you want before the deadline.

steps.title: Submit the tax return
steps.description: If everything is correct, click "Submit" or "Send" at the bottom of the page. You will receive confirmation that the tax return has been submitted. If you don't make changes, it will be automatically submitted at the deadline.
steps.tip: You will receive a receipt by email or in your inbox on Altinn.

fradrag.title: Add deductions
fradrag.description: How to add deductions to your tax return
fradrag.longDescription: Deductions reduce your tax. Many forget deductions they are entitled to! Here we show you all the deductions and how to add them.
fradrag.whatIsText: Deductions are expenses that are subtracted from your income before tax is calculated. The more deductions you have, the less tax you pay.
fradrag.exampleText: If you earn NOK 500,000 and have NOK 50,000 in deductions, you pay tax on NOK 450,000 instead. With a tax rate of 22%, you save about NOK 11,000 in tax!
fradrag.allDeductionsTitle: All deductions you may be entitled to
fradrag.allDeductionsText: Go through the list and check if anything applies to you!
fradrag.tipText: The Tax Office can ask for documentation of your deductions for up to 10 years. Take photos of receipts and store them digitally.

items.name: Commute to work
items.description: If you have more than 37 km one way to work, you can get a deduction
items.amount: Approx. NOK 1.76 per km over 37 km

items.name: Union membership fee
items.description: Union membership automatically gives a deduction

items.name: Home office
items.description: If you work from home regularly, you can get a deduction

items.name: Tools and equipment
items.description: Equipment you need for your job that your employer doesn't cover

items.name: Interest expenses
items.description: Interest on mortgage, car loan, student loan, etc.

items.name: BSU (Housing savings for young people)
items.description: Savings for housing for those under 34

items.name: Maintenance of rental property
items.description: Maintenance costs if you rent out property

items.name: Gifts to voluntary organizations
items.description: Gifts to approved organizations (Red Cross, Doctors Without Borders, etc.)

items.name: Childcare deduction
items.description: Expenses for kindergarten, after-school care, childminder
items.amount: Up to NOK 25,000 for one child, +15,000 per additional child

items.name: Special deduction for single provider
items.description: If you live alone with children

items.name: Special deduction for major illness expenses
items.description: Expenses over NOK 9,180 for illness not covered

items.name: Interest on student loan
items.description: Interest you pay on student loans

steps.title: Log in to skatteetaten.no
steps.description: Go to skatteetaten.no and log in with BankID. Go to your tax return.

steps.title: Find "Deductions" or "Edit"
steps.description: In the tax return you see an overview of all items. Find the section for deductions, or click "Edit" next to the item you want to add deductions for.

steps.title: Choose type of deduction
steps.description: Choose what type of deduction you want to add from the list. The most common are travel expenses, interest expenses, union fees and gifts to voluntary organizations.
steps.tip: See the list below for all deductions you may be entitled to!

steps.title: Enter the amount
steps.description: Enter the amount you are claiming as a deduction. You must be able to document the amount if the Tax Office asks.
steps.warning: Don't guess the amount! You must have receipts or other documentation.

steps.title: Save the change
steps.description: Click "Save" or "Add" to save the deduction. You immediately see how it affects your tax.

steps.title: Repeat for other deductions
steps.description: Go through the list below and check if you have other deductions you've forgotten. Add all you're entitled to.

steps.title: See the new tax calculation
steps.description: After adding all deductions, you see at the bottom of the page how much you save in tax, or if you get more back.
steps.tip: Green number = more money back. Red number = you have to pay more.

skattekort.title: Change tax card
skattekort.description: How to change your tax card
skattekort.longDescription: The tax card determines how much tax is deducted from your salary each month. If your life situation changes, you should update it.
skattekort.whatIsText: The tax card tells your employer how much tax to deduct from your salary. It is based on expected income and deductions.

cardTypes.desc: Used for fixed monthly deductions. Most common for employees.
A fixed percentage is deducted regardless of amount. Common for secondary jobs.

skattekort.whenToChangeTitle: When should you change your tax card?
whenToChangeList: You got a new job with higher or lower salary
You started or quit a secondary job
You took out a mortgage (large interest expenses)
You became a single parent or got a partner
You are paying too much or too little tax
skattekort.stepsTitle: How to change your tax card

steps.title: Log in to skatteetaten.no
steps.description: Go to skatteetaten.no and log in with BankID. Click "Logg inn" in the top right corner.

steps.title: Find "Skattekort"
steps.description: After logging in, look for "Skattekort" in the menu or on the front page. Click to see your current tax card.

steps.title: View current tax card
steps.description: You now see your tax card with table number and percentage rate. The table number is used by your employer to deduct the correct tax.
steps.tip: Table number 7100 is standard for most people. Lower number = less tax deduction.

steps.title: Click "Endre skattekort"
steps.description: If you want to change the tax card, click "Endre" or "Bestill nytt skattekort".

steps.title: Enter income changes
steps.description: Fill in what you expect to earn this year. If you got a new job, higher salary, or lost income, update this.
steps.tip: Be as accurate as possible. Too high estimate = too much tax. Too low = additional tax due.

steps.title: Add deductions you know about
steps.description: If you know you will have large deductions (mortgage, travel expenses), you can add this now to reduce the tax deduction.
steps.warning: Don't overestimate deductions - then you risk additional tax due next year.

steps.title: View the new tax deduction
steps.description: The calculator shows you what the new tax deduction will be. Compare with today's to see the change.

steps.title: Confirm the change
steps.description: If you are satisfied, click "Bestill" or "Bekreft". The new tax card is sent automatically to your employer.
steps.tip: Your employer receives the new tax card electronically within a few days.

skattekort.tooMuchTaxTitle: Are you paying too much tax?
skattekort.tooMuchTaxText: If you get a lot of money back on your taxes every year, you are probably paying too much.
skattekort.tooMuchTaxSolution: Change your tax card to receive more each month instead of waiting for the tax settlement.
skattekort.tooLittleTaxTitle: Are you paying too little tax?
skattekort.tooLittleTaxText: If you often have additional tax due, you should increase the tax deduction.
skattekort.tooLittleTaxSolution: Change your tax card to deduct more tax each month and avoid large bills in June.
skattekort.tipText: The new tax card for next year arrives automatically in December. You don't need to order it yourself unless you want to make changes.

skatteoppgjoer.title: View your tax settlement
skatteoppgjoer.description: Find and understand your tax settlement
skatteoppgjoer.longDescription: Learn how to find and understand your tax settlement. Find out if you're getting money back or have to pay additional tax.
skatteoppgjoer.whenTitle: When does the tax settlement come?
skatteoppgjoer.whenNote: You'll receive an SMS or email when the tax settlement is ready.
skatteoppgjoer.stepsTitle: How to find your tax settlement

steps.title: Go to skatteetaten.no
steps.description: Open your browser and type "skatteetaten.no" in the address bar.
steps.tip: You can also search for "Skatteetaten" on Google.

steps.title: Log in with BankID
steps.description: Click "Logg inn" at the top of the page. Choose BankID and follow the instructions.

steps.title: Find "Skatteoppgjør"
steps.description: After logging in, find and click on "Skatteoppgjør" or "Se skatteoppgjøret". You often find this on the front page after logging in.
steps.tip: The tax settlement usually comes in June-October, depending on when you submitted your tax return.

steps.title: Select which year
steps.description: If you want to see old tax settlements, select the correct year from the list. The newest is usually shown at the top.

steps.title: Read the tax settlement
steps.description: You now see an overview of your taxes. The most important numbers are: "Fastsatt skatt" (what you should pay in total), "Innbetalt forskuddsskatt/skattetrekk" (what you've already paid), and "Restskatt/Til gode" (if you owe or get back).
steps.tip: Green amount = money back. Red amount = additional tax you must pay.

steps.title: Understand the result
steps.description: If you have money coming back, it's paid automatically to your account. If you have additional tax, you get information about when and how to pay.
steps.warning: Additional tax over 1000 kr is divided into two installments. Check the due dates!

steps.title: Download the tax settlement
steps.description: You can download the tax settlement as PDF by clicking "Last ned" or "Skriv ut". This can be useful for loan applications or documentation.

skatteoppgjoer.moneyBackText: If you have money coming back, it's paid automatically to the account registered with the Tax Office.
moneyBackList: Check that your account number is updated
skatteoppgjoer.additionalTaxText: If you have additional tax, you must pay before the due date to avoid interest.

additionalTaxList.label: Over 1000 kr
additionalTaxList.text: Divided into two installments (usually August and October)
You can pay with online banking - use the KID number from the tax settlement

faq.q: I think the tax settlement is wrong
faq.a: You can appeal the tax settlement within 6 weeks. Go to "Klage på skatteoppgjøret" at skatteetaten.no.

faq.q: Can I change the account number for payment?
faq.a: Yes, log in to skatteetaten.no and update your account number under "Min profil".

faq.q: I can't afford to pay the additional tax
faq.a: You can apply for a payment plan with the Tax Office. Contact them as soon as possible.

skatteattest.title: Order tax certificate
skatteattest.description: How to order a tax certificate
skatteattest.longDescription: Learn how to order a tax certificate online. You get it immediately, completely free.
skatteattest.whatIsText: A tax certificate is a document showing that you or your company do not owe any taxes or fees to the state.
skatteattest.whatIsNeededFor: You may need a tax certificate to:
whatIsNeededForList: Document tax status to banks or others
skatteattest.stepsTitle: How to order a tax certificate

steps.title: Go to skatteetaten.no
steps.description: Open your browser and type "skatteetaten.no" in the address bar.

steps.title: Log in with BankID
steps.description: Click "Logg inn" at the top of the page. Choose BankID and follow the instructions.

steps.title: Search for "Skatteattest"
steps.description: After logging in, use the search field and type "skatteattest". Click on the result called "Bestill skatteattest" or similar.
steps.tip: You can also find this under "Bestillinger" or "Attester og bekreftelser".

steps.title: Choose type of tax certificate
steps.description: There are different types of tax certificates. Choose the one that fits your purpose: "Skatteattest for offentlige anskaffelser" is the most common.
steps.warning: Check with the recipient which type of certificate they need.

steps.title: Fill in information
steps.description: You may be asked to specify what the certificate will be used for. Fill in the required fields.

steps.title: Order the certificate
steps.description: Click "Bestill" or "Send bestilling". The certificate is usually created immediately.
steps.tip: Most tax certificates can be downloaded immediately as PDF.

steps.title: Download the certificate
steps.description: When the certificate is ready, click "Last ned" or "Åpne". Save the file on your computer.
steps.tip: The tax certificate is valid for 6 months from the date of issue.

importantList.label: Validity period
importantList.text: The tax certificate is valid for 6 months from the date of issue

importantList.label: Free
importantList.text: It costs nothing to order a tax certificate

importantList.label: Owed taxes
importantList.text: If you owe taxes, you cannot get a tax certificate until the debt is paid

faq.q: I can't get a tax certificate because I owe taxes
faq.a: You must pay the tax debt first. Log in to skatteetaten.no to see what you owe and pay.

faq.q: Can I order a tax certificate for my company?
faq.a: Yes, but you must have access rights in Altinn for the company. Log in with BankID and select your company.

faq.q: How do I send the tax certificate to someone?
faq.a: Download the PDF file and send it as an email attachment, or print it and deliver it physically.

loggInn.title: Log in to the Tax Office
loggInn.description: Learn how to log in to skatteetaten.no
loggInn.longDescription: Learn how to log in to the Tax Office to see your tax return, tax settlement and change tax card.
loggInn.beforeYouStartText: You need BankID to log in to the Tax Office. MinID gives limited access to some services.
loggInn.stepsTitle: How to log in to the Tax Office
loggInn.servicesTitle: What can you do when logged in?
services: View tax settlement and any additional tax
View overview of assets and debt
loggInn.problemsText: If you have problems logging in:
problemsList: Check that the BankID app is updated
Call the Tax Office at 800 80 000 for help

steps.title: Go to skatteetaten.no
steps.description: Open your browser and type "skatteetaten.no" in the address bar. Press Enter.
steps.tip: You can also search for "Skatteetaten" on Google.

steps.title: Find the "Log in" button
steps.description: Look for "Logg inn" or "Min side" in the top right corner of the page. Click the button.
steps.tip: The button is usually green or blue.

steps.title: Choose BankID
steps.description: You get the choice between BankID on mobile or BankID with code device. Choose the one you use.
steps.warning: The Tax Office requires BankID for full access. MinID gives limited access.

steps.title: BankID on mobile
steps.description: Enter your national ID number (11 digits). You will receive a message on your phone - open the BankID app and approve the login.
steps.tip: Make sure the BankID app is installed and updated.

steps.title: BankID with code device
steps.description: Enter your national ID number. Turn on the code device and enter the code shown on the screen. Enter your personal code on the device and use the new code that appears.
steps.warning: If the code device is out of battery, contact your bank.

steps.title: You are logged in!
steps.description: You are now on "Min side" at the Tax Office. Here you can see the tax return, tax settlement, and change tax card.
steps.tip: Remember to log out when you are done, especially on a shared computer.

bestilleTime.title: Book doctor's appointment
bestilleTime.description: How to book an appointment with your GP
bestilleTime.longDescription: Learn how to book an appointment with your GP via Helsenorge. You can book an appointment at any time - including evenings and weekends.
whatYouNeedList: Know approximately which day and time suits you
bestilleTime.stepsTitle: How to book a doctor's appointment

steps.title: Log in to helsenorge.no
steps.description: Go to helsenorge.no and log in with BankID or MinID. Click "Logg inn" in the top right corner.
steps.tip: See our guide "Log in to Health Norway" if you need help.

steps.title: Find "Appointments"
steps.description: After logging in you see the "My health" menu. Click on "Timeavtaler" or "Bestill time".
steps.tip: You can also search for "bestille time" in the search field.

steps.title: Select "Book new appointment"
steps.description: Click the button "Bestill ny time" or "Ny timeavtale". You get an overview of where you can book an appointment.

steps.title: Select your GP
steps.description: Click on your GP in the list. If you don't see your doctor, the medical office may not offer online booking.
steps.warning: Not all medical offices have online booking. Then you must call to book an appointment.

steps.title: Select type of appointment
steps.description: Choose what the appointment is about. Common choices are "Regular appointment", "Phone consultation" or "Video consultation". Choose what suits best.
steps.tip: Video consultation is practical for simple things like prescription renewal or follow-up.

steps.title: Select date and time
steps.description: You see a calendar with available times. Green fields mean available. Click on a date to see available times. Choose the time that suits you.
steps.tip: If no times suit you, try looking a few weeks ahead.

steps.title: Write briefly about the reason
steps.description: You can write a short description of why you need an appointment. This helps the doctor prepare. You don't need to write everything - just the main reason.
steps.tip: Example: "Have had a cough for two weeks" or "Want to discuss blood pressure medication".

steps.title: Confirm the appointment
steps.description: Review the information and click "Confirm" or "Book appointment". You receive confirmation on screen and by SMS/email.
steps.tip: Add the appointment to your calendar so you don't forget it!

bestilleTime.cancelText: You can cancel or change the appointment on Helsenorge. Go to "Appointments" and click on the appointment you want to change. Cancel at least 24 hours before if possible, so others can use the slot.
bestilleTime.cantBookOnlineText: Some medical offices do not offer online booking. Then you must call the medical office directly. You can find the phone number on helsenorge.no under "My GP".
benefits: Open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
You see all available times and choose yourself

faq.q: ...there are no available times?
faq.a: Call the medical office directly. They can often find solutions for urgent needs.

faq.q: ...my GP doesn't have online booking?
faq.a: Some medical offices haven't activated online booking. Then you must call to book an appointment.

faq.q: ...I need to cancel the appointment?
faq.a: Log in to Helsenorge, go to "My appointments" and click "Cancel". Do this at least 24 hours before the appointment.

faq.q: ...I'm acutely ill?
faq.a: Call the medical office or emergency services at 116 117. Don't use online booking for acute illness.

resepter.title: View and renew prescriptions
resepter.description: Check your prescriptions and request renewal
resepter.longDescription: On Helsenorge you can see all your prescriptions and request renewal without calling the doctor. Easy and fast!
resepter.stepsTitle: How to view and renew prescriptions

steps.title: Log in to helsenorge.no
steps.description: Go to helsenorge.no and log in with BankID. Click "Logg inn" in the top right corner.
steps.warning: You must use BankID (not MinID) to see prescriptions.

steps.title: Find "Prescriptions"
steps.description: After logging in, click on "Resepter" in the menu or on the front page. You can also search for "resepter".

steps.title: View your active prescriptions
steps.description: You see a list of all your prescriptions. Green prescriptions are active (valid). Red or gray are expired. Click on a prescription to see details.
steps.tip: You can see how many refills are left and when the prescription expires.

steps.title: Request prescription renewal
steps.description: If a prescription is about to expire or you need new medicine, click "Request renewal". Write a short message to the doctor about why you need renewal.
steps.tip: Example: "Have used this for 2 years, works well. Want renewal."

steps.title: Wait for response from doctor
steps.description: The doctor reviews the request and renews the prescription if appropriate. This usually takes 1-3 business days. You'll be notified when the prescription is renewed.
steps.warning: The doctor may say no to renewal and ask you to come for a check-up first. This is normal for some medicines.

steps.title: Pick up medicine at the pharmacy
steps.description: When the prescription is renewed, you can pick up the medicine at any pharmacy. They can see your prescription when you provide your national ID number.
steps.tip: You can also order medicines from online pharmacies and have them delivered home.

tips: Request renewal well in advance - preferably 1-2 weeks before the medicine runs out
Always have enough medicine to wait for the doctor to renew
Some medicines require a doctor's appointment before renewal (e.g. blood pressure medication)
E-prescriptions are valid for 1 year from when they are issued

whatYouFind.label: Dosage
whatYouFind.desc: How much and when to take the medicine

whatYouFind.label: Refills remaining
whatYouFind.desc: How many times you can pick up

prescriptionTypes.desc: Most medicines. You pay full price or co-payment.
For chronic conditions. The state covers most, you pay small co-payment.
Special medicines only used in hospitals or outpatient clinics.

faq.q: Can all prescriptions be renewed without an appointment?
faq.a: No, some medicines (like strong painkillers or sleeping pills) require a new evaluation. Then you must book an appointment.

faq.q: How long does renewal take?
faq.a: Usually 1-3 business days, but it can vary. Request renewal well before the medicine runs out!

faq.q: Can I pick up medicine at a different pharmacy?
faq.a: Yes! Your prescriptions are stored electronically and can be picked up at any pharmacy in Norway.

faq.q: What do I do if the prescription has expired?
faq.a: Contact your doctor to get a new prescription. Use Helsenorge or call the medical office.

resepter.tipBoxText: At felleskatalogen.no you can look up your medicine and read about side effects, dosage and what you should know.

bytteFastlege.title: Change GP
bytteFastlege.description: How to change to a new GP
bytteFastlege.longDescription: You have the right to change GP if you wish. It's free and you can do it yourself online.
bytteFastlege.goodToKnow: Good to know before you switch
goodToKnowList: You can change GP up to 2 times per year
The change takes effect from the 1st of next month
You can choose any doctor with available spots

steps.title: Log in to helsenorge.no
steps.description: Go to helsenorge.no and log in with BankID or MinID. Click "Logg inn" in the top right corner.

steps.title: Find "Change GP"
steps.description: Click on "Min fastlege" or search for "bytte fastlege". Select "Bytt fastlege" or "Finn ny fastlege".

steps.title: Search for new doctor
steps.description: You can search by doctor's name, medical office or area. You also see which doctors have available spots near you.
steps.tip: Green number = available spots. Red or 0 = full.

steps.title: Check information about the doctor
steps.description: Click on a doctor to see more info: opening hours, address, languages, and whether they offer online booking. Read reviews from other patients if available.

steps.title: Select the doctor and confirm
steps.description: When you have found a doctor you want, click "Select this doctor" or "Switch to this doctor". Confirm your choice.
steps.warning: The change takes effect from the 1st of next month. Until then you are still with your old doctor.

steps.title: Done!
steps.description: You receive confirmation of the switch. From next month the new doctor is your GP. Your medical records are automatically transferred to the new office.
steps.tip: Remember to cancel any appointments with the old doctor.

bytteFastlege.noSpaceText: If the doctor you want is full, you can put yourself on a waiting list. You'll be notified when a spot becomes available. You can also try calling the medical office - sometimes they have spots that don't show online.

faq.q: What if I can't find a doctor with available spots?
faq.a: You can put yourself on the waiting list for doctors who are full. The municipality must ensure you have a GP.

faq.q: Can I use my old doctor while I wait?
faq.a: Yes, you can still use your current GP until the switch takes effect.

faq.q: What happens to my medical records?
faq.a: The new GP gets access to your records automatically. You don't need to do anything.

journal.title: Read patient records
journal.description: Find and read your own patient records
journal.longDescription: You have the right to see what has been written about you at the doctor. On Helsenorge you can read your records yourself.
journal.whatIsJournalText: The record contains notes from doctor visits, test results, diagnoses and treatments. Everything the doctor writes about you is collected here.

steps.title: Log in to helsenorge.no
steps.description: Go to helsenorge.no and log in with BankID. Click "Logg inn" in the top right corner.
steps.warning: You must use BankID (not MinID) to see the records.

steps.title: Find "Patient record"
steps.description: Click on "Pasientjournal" in the menu or search for "journal". You can also find it under "Min helse".

steps.title: Choose which record to view
steps.description: You may have records in several places: GP, hospital, specialist. Choose who you want to see the record from.
steps.tip: Core record shows the most important information from all places combined.

steps.title: Read the record notes
steps.description: You see a list of all record notes, with the newest at the top. Click on a note to read the full text.
steps.tip: The record may contain medical terminology. Feel free to use our dictionary or ask the doctor if something is unclear.

steps.title: View test results
steps.description: Under "Test results" or "Lab results" you find results from blood tests and other tests. Values outside the normal range are often marked.
steps.tip: Ask the doctor if you're wondering what the test results mean.

journal.delayText: Some records have a delay of a few days before you can see them. This is so the doctor has time to inform you first if there is something important. Hospitals and specialists may have longer delays.
journal.whatYouFindTitle: What can you find in the records?
whatYouFind: Notes from doctor visits and consultations
Results from blood tests and examinations

faq.q: I don't understand what's written in the records
faq.a: Medical records are written by healthcare professionals and may contain medical terminology. Ask your doctor to explain.

faq.q: Something is wrong in my records
faq.a: You can request correction of errors. Contact the doctor's office or hospital that made the error.

faq.q: I can't find records from the hospital
faq.a: Not all hospitals have connected to Helsenorge yet. Contact the hospital directly to get a copy of the records.

melding.title: Send message to doctor
melding.longDescription: You can send messages to your GP via Helsenorge. Practical for simple questions that don't require an appointment.
melding.whenToUseTitle: When should you send a message?
whenToUseGoodList: Inform about changes in health condition
melding.stepsTitle: How to send a message to the doctor

steps.title: Log in to helsenorge.no
steps.description: Go to helsenorge.no and log in with BankID or MinID. Click "Logg inn" in the top right corner.

steps.title: Find "Messages"
steps.description: Click on "Meldinger" or "Contact doctor" in the menu. You can also find it under "Min fastlege".

steps.title: Start new message
steps.description: Click on "New message" or "Write message". Select your GP as recipient.
steps.warning: Not all medical offices have the messaging service. Then you must call.

steps.title: Write the message
steps.description: Write a short and clear message. Explain what it's about. The clearer you are, the better answer you'll get.
steps.tip: Example: "Hi, I have used Paracetamol for 3 days for headache without improvement. Should I come for an appointment, or is there something else I can try?"

steps.title: Send the message
steps.description: Review the message and click "Send". You receive confirmation that the message has been sent.

steps.title: Wait for response
steps.description: The doctor usually responds within 1-3 business days. You'll be notified by SMS or email when the answer arrives. Log in to Helsenorge to read the answer.
steps.warning: For acute problems, don't wait for a response - call the emergency room (116 117) or ambulance (113).

faq.q: How long does it take to get a response?
faq.a: Usually 1-3 business days. During holiday periods it may take longer.

faq.q: Are my messages secure?
faq.a: Yes, everything on Helsenorge is encrypted and secure. Only you and the medical office can read the messages.

faq.q: Can I attach images?
faq.a: Yes, many medical offices let you attach images. This can be useful for showing rashes or wounds.

loggInn.title: Log in to Health Norway
loggInn.description: Learn how to log in to helsenorge.no
loggInn.longDescription: Learn how to log in to Health Norway to see prescriptions, book doctor's appointments and read records.
loggInn.beforeYouStartText: You need BankID or MinID to log in to Health Norway. BankID gives access to most services.
loggInn.stepsTitle: How to log in to Health Norway
loggInn.servicesTitle: What can you do when logged in?
loggInn.problemsText: If you have problems logging in:
problemsList: Check that the BankID app is updated
Call Health Norway at 23 32 70 00 for help

steps.title: Go to helsenorge.no
steps.description: Open your browser and type "helsenorge.no" in the address bar. Press Enter.
steps.tip: You can also search for "Helsenorge" on Google.

steps.title: Find the "Log in" button
steps.description: Look for "Logg inn" in the top right corner of the page. Click the button.
steps.tip: The button is usually red or dark.

steps.title: Choose login method
steps.description: You can choose between BankID on mobile, BankID with code device, or MinID. BankID gives access to all services.
steps.warning: MinID gives limited access on Health Norway. BankID is recommended.

steps.title: BankID on mobile
steps.description: Enter your national ID number (11 digits). You receive a message on your phone - open the BankID app and approve the login.
steps.tip: Make sure the BankID app is installed and updated.

steps.title: BankID with code device
steps.description: Enter your national ID number. Turn on the code device and enter the code shown on screen. Enter your personal code on the device and use the new code that appears.
steps.warning: If the code device is out of battery, contact your bank.

steps.title: You are logged in!
steps.description: You are now on "My health" at Health Norway. Here you can see prescriptions, book doctor's appointments, and read records.
steps.tip: Remember to log out when you are done, especially on a shared computer.

bankid.title: Safe use of BankID
bankid.description: Learn to use BankID safely and avoid fraud
bankid.longDescription: BankID is your digital identity. Here you learn how to use it safely and protect yourself from scammers.
bankid.whatIsText1: BankID is an electronic ID that confirms who you are on the internet. It's like a digital passport that lets you log in to public services, online banking and sign documents.
bankid.whatIsText2: BankID is issued by your bank and is linked to your national ID number. When you use BankID, you confirm that it's really you logging in or signing.
bankid.typeMobileDesc: The most common type. You receive a message on your phone and approve with fingerprint, face or code.
bankid.typeCodeDeviceDesc: A small device that shows one-time codes. Used together with a personal password.
bankid.typeBiometricDesc: Uses fingerprint or facial recognition directly in the browser.

steps.title: Always read what you're approving
steps.description: When you receive a BankID request on your phone, ALWAYS read the text showing what you're approving. It shows who is asking for approval and what it concerns.
steps.warning: NEVER approve a BankID request you didn't start yourself!

steps.title: Check that the website is real
steps.description: Before using BankID, look at the address bar in the browser. Real websites have a padlock icon and the address starts with https://. Double-check that the domain is correct (e.g. nav.no, not nav-login.com).
steps.tip: Always type the address yourself instead of clicking links in email or SMS.

steps.title: Never share your codes
steps.description: BankID codes, passwords and personal codes should NEVER be shared with anyone. The bank, police or NAV will never ask you for this information.
steps.warning: No one is allowed to ask for your BankID codes. If someone does, it's ALWAYS fraud!

steps.title: Use a secure code
steps.description: Choose a personal code that is difficult to guess. Don't use birth date, 1234 or other simple combinations. Only you should know the code.
steps.tip: A good code can be four random numbers you memorize.

steps.title: Keep the app updated
steps.description: Make sure the BankID app is always updated to the latest version. Updates contain important security improvements.
steps.tip: Turn on automatic updates in App Store or Google Play.

steps.title: Log out after use
steps.description: When you're done using a service, always log out. This is especially important if you're using a shared computer or someone else's phone.

steps.title: Be alert to unexpected requests
steps.description: If you suddenly receive a BankID request without having started anything yourself, it's probably a fraud attempt. Reject the request and contact your bank.
steps.warning: Call your bank immediately if you've approved something you shouldn't have!

bankid.warningText: Be on alert if you experience any of this:
warningSigns: Someone calls claiming to be from the bank and needs BankID approval
You receive a BankID request you didn't start yourself
Someone asks you to install programs like AnyDesk or TeamViewer
You're asked to provide codes over the phone
It's very urgent and you don't have time to think
neverShare: One-time codes from the code device
Your national ID number together with codes
Access to your phone during a BankID process
bankid.ifSuspiciousTitle: What do you do if you suspect fraud?
bankid.ifSuspiciousText: If you think you've been subjected to a fraud attempt, do the following:
bankid.ifSuspicious1: Reject all BankID requests you haven't started yourself
bankid.ifSuspicious2: Call your bank immediately at the number on the back of your bank card
bankid.ifSuspicious3: Change passwords and codes if you have shared anything
bankid.ifSuspicious4: Report the incident to the police at politiet.no

phishing.title: Recognize phishing
phishing.description: Learn to spot fake emails and messages
phishing.longDescription: Phishing is fraud attempts that try to trick you into giving away personal information. Here you learn to recognize and avoid them.
phishing.whatIsText1: Phishing is when scammers send fake emails, SMS or messages pretending to come from a trusted sender, like your bank, NAV or the postal service.
phishing.whatIsText2: The goal is to trick you into clicking a link, downloading a file, or providing personal information like passwords and bank details.
phishing.examplePostText: "Your package is waiting. Pay 29 kr shipping here: [link]"
phishing.examplePostWarning: The postal service never sends SMS about payment via links!
phishing.exampleBankText: "Important: Your account will be blocked. Confirm your details here: [link]"
phishing.exampleBankWarning: Banks never threaten to block accounts via email!
phishing.exampleNavText: "You have money due from NAV. Log in to receive: [link]"
phishing.exampleNavWarning: NAV never sends links for payment via email!

steps.title: Check the sender address carefully
steps.description: Look at the entire email address, not just the name. Real email from NAV comes from @nav.no, not @nav-support.com or similar. Scammers use addresses that look similar but aren't quite right.
steps.tip: Hover the mouse over the sender name to see the actual email address.

steps.title: Look for spelling mistakes and poor language
steps.description: Phishing messages often have spelling errors, strange wording or poor grammar. Real messages from public agencies are written correctly.
steps.tip: Read the message aloud - does it sound unnatural? Then it's probably a scam.

steps.title: Be skeptical of links
steps.description: Don't click on links in emails or SMS you didn't expect. Hover the mouse over the link to see where it actually goes. Scammers use addresses that look like real websites.
steps.warning: Instead, go directly to the website by typing the address yourself in the browser.

steps.title: Don't react to urgency
steps.description: Phishing messages often try to stress you: "Act NOW!", "Your account will be blocked in 24 hours!". Real senders always give you time to think.
steps.tip: The more urgent it is, the more reason to be suspicious.

steps.title: Check if you expected the message
